block.p: Children can learn about pumpkins on Saturday in a program sponsored by the American Institute of Wine and Food, an educational group, and Just Food, which sponsors food cooperatives. The event, from 2 to 4 p.m. at the Amish Market, 240 East 45th Street, will include a lesson in making vegetable pizzas. It is free but reservations are necessary: (212) 867-3929.

A food drive for City Harvest, which collects food for the homeless, will be held on Friday, Saturday and Sunday at the Union Square Greenmarket. In recognition of the 700,000 pounds of food the Greenmarket farmers have donated to City Harvest this year, the Greenmarket is asking customers to buy extra food to donate to the charity.

The Culinary Historians of New York will discuss Thomas Jefferson's tours of the wine regions of Europe at its meeting on Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. at the Mount Vernon Hotel Museum, 417 East 61st Street. There will be wines and 18th-century-style hors d'oeuvres for tasting. The fee is $20 for members, $25 for nonmembers: (212) 744-3479.

What did historical figures like Marie Antoinette, Talleyrand and Casanova eat? Following lectures about historic dinners, held at Sotheby's Institute of Art, an educational branch of the auction house, 1334 York Avenue (72nd Street), there will be dinners with the foods, at Nicholson's, 323 East 58th Street.

The lectures will be given on Oct. 23, Nov. 13 and Dec. 11, from 6:30 to 8 p.m. Lecture tickets are $25. The dinners, starting at about 8:30, are $30 a person on Oct. 23 (not a seated dinner), $75 on Nov. 13 and $110 on Dec. 11. Prices do not include tax and tip. For lecture reservations: (212) 894-1111. For dinner reservations: (212) 355-6769.

Action Against Hunger USA is an international organization founded in 1979 that provides emergency relief to prevent famine. From Monday through Oct. 19, a number of restaurants will make donations to the group, either in cash or as a percentage of profits. The public can help by patronizing the participating restaurants. For information on which restaurants have joined the campaign: www.aah-usa.org.
